description.narrative: COOPower is a project that aims to promote the social enterprise and cooperative sector to young people as an alternative career pathway in Cyprus, Greece and Croatia. The 18 months programme was launched in March 2020 and it is funded by the EU as part of the DG GROW programme 'Reducing youth unemployment: setting up co-operatives to enhance working opportunities in the EU. The project is implemented by the British Council in partnership with the General Secretariat for Vocational Education, Training and Lifelong Learning in Greece and the Science and Technology Park of the University of Rijeka (STEP RI) in Croatia.
The project targets groups are: young people, especially those not in employment, training or education, stakeholders from the social economy sector, the general public.

The project will include the following activities: training of a team of young journalists, organisation of hackathon style events (COOPAthons and Country Final) in the three partner countries, a study visit to the UK for COOPAthon country final winning teams, an awareness raising campaign about the social economy sector, a final project conference.
